text: A National personification are concepts such as nations, emotions, and natural forces/phenomena, such as seasons and weather in relation to personae characteristics of a state or the people(s) it inhabits. It may appear in political mascots and cultural depictions. == List of national personifications == Location Image Personification Animal used for the same purpose Europa or Europa regina Zeus as a white bull Hellas Bharat Mata ("Mother India") Bengal tiger, Indian elephant Ériu, Banba, Fódla, Kathleen Ni Houlihan, Hibernia, The Old Woman of BeareO'Rourke Murphy, M. & MacKillop, J. (2006). An Irish Literature Reader: Poetry, Prose, Drama. Handala Pak Watan - "A term of Endearment for Pakistan" which is "Mumlikat-e-Khudadad" ('God-Given State') Himalayan Snow spotted Tiger Britannia (United Kingdom), John Bull (England), Dame Wales (Wales) The Lion and the Unicorn (England and Scotland), Bulldog (United Kingdom), Welsh dragon (Wales) Uncle Sam (government personification), Lady Liberty, Columbia, Johnny Reb (The South, obsolete), Billy Yank (The North, obsolete), Brother Jonathan (New England, obsolete) Bald Eagle, Timber rattlesnake (American Revolution, obsolete) ==Related pages== * National emblem, for other metaphors for nations. *Polandball, a satirical Internet meme where countries are depicted as balls. ==References== Category:Symbols
title: National personification
